abstract: A ruling would let providers slow down access to certain content and favor their services over those of competitors.
snippet: A ruling would let providers slow down access to certain content and favor their services over those of competitors.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday that regulators had limited power over Web traffic under current law. The decision will allow Internet service companies to block or slow specific sites and charge video sites like YouTube to deliver their content faster to users.

headline.main: U.S. Court Curbs F.C.C. Authority on Web Traffic
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Curbs F.C.C. Authority On Web Traffic
